intro: Rosa caryophyllacea f. zajartakrivularis, commonly known as the Zajartakrivularis rose, is a rare and distinctive botanical variant of the species Rosa caryophyllacea. This form exhibits unique floral characteristics, including a strikingly vivid red coloration and a compact, bushy growth habit. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. The plant is noted for its ornamental value, with its dense foliage and showy flowers making it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered cultivar.
